{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3603596,"name":"Davion Ortiz","username":"DavionFrom2359","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/7bcc69/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-25T14:35:09.216Z","cooked":"

Hi There, I’m a student member from team 2359, and I’m hoping to grow my teams CAD resources over my time on the team.

My team only uses CAD for designing select parts for CNC milling and 3D printing, but my hope is that our team can CAD our whole robot by the time I become a senior. However, only me and two of our mentors tend to use CAD, so I will have to teach my team anything I learn.

I am additionally still new to CAD.

My request is for advice, custom functions, resources, and tools that can aid my team in using Onshape for FRC.

(I am already using online resources and tools from Onshape4Frc and similar online tools)

Thank you in advance, and sincerely,

Davion from 2359

https://www.frcdesign.org/ is a really great resource if you aren’t already using it!

I had been planning on looking at it while at home, since it’s blocked on the computers from our schools, but had completely forgotten!!!

I’ll remember to use it now, so thanks!

Look at the slideshow on this thread:

CMP Conference Slides - Onshape Best Practices for FRC Design Technical
Here are the slides from the presentation I gave at FIRST Champs. I had a lot of questions about where they’d be posted, so here they are! Onshape Best Practices for FRC - Championship The recording will be posted to YouTube and tagged here as well once we’re done editing and cleaning it up. The slides above are pretty similar to the ones I used at the NE Mentor Conference, so I’m curious if anyone has suggestions - should any topics be detailed further? Are there topics that should be added? …

I didn’t attend this seminar this year, but it appears very close to last year when I did. There are a lot of good tips for organizing your robot and keeping the CAD speedy.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-04-25T16:13:32.803Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":53.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500487,"topic_slug":"requesting-helpful-onshape-cad-tools-and-advice","display_username":"Davion Ortiz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60721,"username":"AndrewCard","name":"Andrew Card","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/96bed5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":75464,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Student"},"post_url":"/t/requesting-helpful-onshape-cad-tools-and-advice/500487/8","custom_user_title":"Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3603821,"name":"Colin","username":"MrMaker589","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrmaker589/{size}/238329_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-25T17:13:22.320Z","cooked":"

My team uses FRCDesign for training because it goes over everything you need to know to have good/clean CAD for a FRC robot.

For tools we use the MKCad Library for importing COTS parts. Along with quite a few Featurescripts that are linked on FRCDesign.

If you have any questions I’d be happy to provide more information.

Thank you for your reply!!!
I will look into FRCDesign, most definitely. Just working out it being blocked on school Chromebooks.

I’ll look into the featurescripts included as well, so thank you.

I’m curious about how your team organizes projects in Onshape for collaboration between members? We currently have a classroom or a team set up, but when a student adds a document, no other students can see it, just the classroom leader.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2025-04-25T17:27:52.761Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":31.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500487,"topic_slug":"requesting-helpful-onshape-cad-tools-and-advice","display_username":"Davion Ortiz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":68625,"username":"MrMaker589","name":"Colin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrmaker589/{size}/238329_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":75464,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Student"},"post_url":"/t/requesting-helpful-onshape-cad-tools-and-advice/500487/10","custom_user_title":"Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3603854,"name":"Colin","username":"MrMaker589","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrmaker589/{size}/238329_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-25T17:37:03.770Z","cooked":"

Right now we have a team set up that we have shared to our design team and any other members that need it.

We plan to have a team account with the school where we are thinking of setting up a classroom to make document ownership easier because right now we our old team is owned by one of our Alumi on there school email and we want to be able to make sure all of docs are managed well and we don’t risk them getting deleted.
I’m not sure is that’s what you were asking but I can clarify further if needed.

The most important reason is it can stop situations where students graduate and leave with previous designs the team wants to retain.

Frcdesign covers pretty much all you will need, but I’ll still say a few words. Sketches are everything, do not underestimate what you can do with good in-sketch skills. It may not be very exciting, but it’s the foundation of everything that comes after. I’m not sure what level you are on, but just try to make your sketches clean and organized, don’t close a sketch if there are still blue lines. Then work on features, try to use as few as possible and a variety, seeing extrude 1-20 is usually not the correct way to make a part. Then look though featurescripts, some are not really useful, but some will save you hours of sanity. Try to make a library of the ones you use most and make them part of your workflow. Then during the season, design under what you think your capabilities are. Being the design lead when overscoped is one of the worst things ever
